No tourist information available anywhere. Not a place to go if you're looking for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Business travelers beware”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyONE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with colleagues. We had a very important package delivered via overnight FedEx to the hotel on our second morning there. Despite noting both our name, room number and telephone number on the package, it was not given to us. Even after checking with the front desk, the package was not located. In fact, it was only after calling the hotel the week AFTER we stayed there, trying to track down the package, that they finally found it. Other frustrations: - the area in front of the hotel that you must pass through in order to park your car is frequently blocked, leaving you waiting for upwards of ten minutes just to get into the parking garage at times - the internet connection is not reliable and wireless is not available in the rooms Plusses: - location is good - Starbucks nearby

Reviews.Title: “Pleased With The Holiday Inn Seattle”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Seattle from November 10, 2007 through November 13, 2007 in room 528. Overall we were very impressed with the quality of the hotel accommodations for the price we paid. We stayed 3 nights through a Southwest Airlines vacation package so we do not know exactly how much the room was per night. Roundtrip air fare from New York, three nights, fees, and taxes came to $799.00 total for the both of us. My guess is that the room cost us about $80 a night. Check-in went very quickly. Kimberly was very friendly and gave us a two-room suite. We were only expecting an ordinary room, but that was a pleasant surprise. The room was very clean and had a living room area with a sofa as well as a bedroom. The room also came with two television sets. The bathroom was a little on the small side, but served all of our basic needs. There were plenty of towels. The shower pressure was very strong. We enjoyed all the complimentary shampoos and soaps and found them to be of a good quality. The bed was very comfortable as well and came with four pillows. The living room also had a sink, refrigerator, counter space, and a microwave. Our room also had a nice view of the Seattle skyline. The location of the hotel was not the greatest, but by being just slightly outside the downtown area, we got a good deal on the price (and so could you). If you walk just 5 minutes west youâ€™re in the downtown area. You are also a 10 minute walk from the Space Needle. We felt completely safe near the hotel. Yes, if youâ€™re walking in the direction of the Space Needle, there is a highway, but all you have to do is walk a block west and youâ€™re at a safe pedestrian crossing. If you do not like walking, there are a number of buses that can get you to downtown and other parts of Seattle. The number 5 or 358 bus can drop you off practically right across the street from the hotel. Buses are only $1.25-$2.00 and free in most of the downtown area. We recommend taking a 194 express bus from the airport to 4th Avenue and University, walking one block west to 3rd Avenue, and taking the 5 bus to the hotel. That bus ticket will only cost you $2.00 as opposed to a $40-$50 taxi ride. There were some minor inconveniences. We did not get maid service our third day there. The made came by at 4:30 pm and I asked her to come back in 15 minutes as we were preparing to attend a Seahawks game. The maid never came back to clean the room. The hotel did not have a pool, which would have been nice. The carpets in the hotel hallways were in need of replacement and clearly showed their age. This hotel met all of our basic needs and we saved a ton of money staying here as opposed to a similar quality hotel that is a 5 minute walk closer to the downtown area. We would definitely stay here again. Marc T. Hardekopf

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a not so great area.”
Reviews.Author: societypnk
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Priceline for $109 a night, which seemed like a fair price for a 3* in Downtown Seattle. The hotel definitely has its pros and cons. PROS: Pretty elegant lobby (as far as Holiday Inns go), incredibly polite and helpful front desk staff, clean and modern rooms, microwave and refrigerator in room, free internet in room, excellent shower pressure, restaurant on site (which I didn't try, but it looked very nice), cheap parking. CON: There is only one con, and it's only a con if you do not have a car with you during your trip. Sadly, the location of the hotel is somewhat inconvenient to downtown Seattle. It is in very close proximity to the space needle, but there is a busy highway next to the hotel, so you have to walk completely out of the way to get to a crosswalk. Overall, it is about a 10 minute walk to the space needle, which isn't too bad, but the walk to the rest of the downtown attractions requires more time and energy. For example, to walk to Pike Place Market is between 25 and 30 minutes. It helps that there is a monorail at the space needle that can take you downtown for $2 each way, but unfortunately it stops running at 11PM, so for late nights walking is your only option. However, the whole time I was there, I never felt unsafe walking around even at night, so the walking can be good if you have the energy. Overall, obviously it would have been nice to stay a hotel closer to downtown attractions, such as the Sheraton, but this hotel was also much cheaper and still had very high quality rooms and service, so I would recommend it for travelers with a car, or enough endurance for the walking.

Reviews.Title: “never go back”
Reviews.Author: travelchic83
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed by the service there-the restaurant is only open for breakfast on Sun-when we wanted lunch. THere is NOT a quick place to grab a bite to eat around, sirens galore (to get an idea about what part of town this location is in-and the staff was extremely rude and not helpful! My advice-pay a little more to stay in a better part of town!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice pillows!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Cat
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel after a week cruising Alaska so we were used to good food and service. No problems at check in at 8:30 in the morning and GOT A ROOM straight away....very impressed - we were expecting to have to leave our cases there until we could check in later in the day. Hallways and lifts are a bit dated but the rooms are OK. Now the pillows...wow so soft and fluffy, a real delight after such hard ones on the cruise. Free Internet was fast and the included breakfast was above average. Overall we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, budget tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: aduckisaduck
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is very nice and accomodating, when I wanted to upgrade my room becasue we needed an extra bed she was very willing and did upgrade us to a room with a pull out sofa. The rooms are a good size and come with a little kitchenette, (microwave, small refrigerator and sink). The beds had spring mattresses and though not completely uncomfortable not the comfort I'm use to in hotels I stay in. There were some wierdness going on in the room above us but this wasn't the hotel's fault. WHen I called down so to complain about my upstair neighbor they were quick to accomadate. A big con was the bath tub did not drain out well so when you took a shower you were standing in about three inches or more of water because the water drained out so slow. I didn't call down about it becasue I was only staying for a night. This Holiday Inn location is not centrally located in the middle of Seattle downtown but its an easy access to it. It's a short walk to the Space Needle and Seattle Center where you can catch the monarail to downtown. The only thing is the monarail runs until about 9 PM and after that you had to take a cab or if you are feeling adventurous the bus back to the hotel. A good tourist hotel, a good pick for the traveller who is on a budget and just needs the basics, plus a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baby_Sokes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay. We booked it on Priceline, where it was compared to Hilton, Marriott and Sheraton. Compared to that, it was disappointing. However, the rooms were clean, nicely decorated, contained microwave, fridge, and a coffeemaker. Other than being really small--they worked. The staff was friendly and the parking was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: ccba
Reviews.Content: I spent a night here in September 2006. I assumed that the Holiday Inn name meant a certain level of quality, but not at this hotel. The hotel is located in a rundown part of town away from the downtown. Can you walk to Pike Place market and other attractions? - Yes, if you bring a good pair of walking shoes. This hotel is really not convenient and other hotels in Seattle would be better if you want to walk around town. The lobby is nice and modern but the furniture in my room was old and the carpet was spotted and dirty. As others have mentioned, if you plan to stay here ask for a room on the top floor. The person in the room above mine had the tv on late into the night and I had a hard time sleeping because I easily could hear it. There were some good things about this hotel: the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and clean. If you can find a room here at a budget price and you dont mind a looonng walk to attractions, consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Melly_Girl
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal through priceline only a few weeks before going there during Bumbershoot (over Labor Day weekend). We were surprised that we got such a low price for the holiday weekend. The non-smoking room didn't smell at all, we were happy with the air conditioning (Seattle was having a heatwave), and the friendly staff. Only bad thing is that we could hear noises from the upstairs room and from the hallway. The maids were around making noise in the morning, but that's only a problem if you're trying to sleep past 8am. Also the parking is only $4.50 a night in the secured garage below the hotel, the spots are a bit on the tight side but that's only if you don't know how to park. I read some people complained the hotel wasn't close to anything? Seattle Center is just a few blocks away, the roads are heavily traveled but that's what the crosswalks are for. And there are multiple bus stops within a block, and the drivers are friendly enough to help get you where you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Value”
Reviews.Author: Phamer
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our 1 night stay here after our cruise. The rooms were clean and functional. The staff was very helpful. Upon a late-night arrival, check-in was smooth. The hotel clerk offered my son a cookie. The next day, the staff checked in our bags while we spent the day in Seattle, and arranged for a private van to pick us up and take us to the airport. They also provided us with a map and directions to downtown. The location is right near the Seattle Center and the Space Needle, so if you're looking to go there, this is perfect. We instead wanted to go down to the waterfront and the Public Market, which was definitely within walking distance for us. The neighborhood around the hotel was pretty quiet and did not feel like the best part of town, but we still felt fine walking around during the day time (not sure about it at night but we had a cab take us right to the hotel from the train station). This was also a great value for us, we got it for $95 on a holiday weekend through Priceline. It is my understanding that this hotel comes up a lot on Priceline as a 3 star hotel, so odds are you can get a room here at a good price for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we only stayed one night!”
Reviews.Author: lkm
Reviews.Content: This is just not a very nice hotel and it is not particularly convenient to anything. It is right on a highway that you would need to cross if you were going to walk downtown. It is a short cab ride, but a pretty long walk. Our room looked out onto a roof and another building and got no sun at all. The rooms were clean enough but looked old and run down. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This review is based on an excellent off-season rate that I got on Priceline ($60) Room was very clean. Fridge & microwave were nice to have. I'm sure that I would have appreciated the location more during summer but it was dark by 4:30PM and we didn't feel safe on the streets after dark. Highly recommend if you are on a budget.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Out there in the real world
Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Inn I've seen”
Reviews.Author: cookofthehouse
Reviews.Content: This is back to back with the Holiday Inn Express, on Dexter Ave about 3 blocks from the space needle. Check in process was friendly and fast. Parking was only $4.50 for our stay, the garage being under the building with a key-entry door. Very safe looking and feeling once we drove in - clean too. I was happy to pay it. Elevator runs a might slow, mostly because you can't encourage the doors to shut with the button. When we got to the room, it was so incredibly clean and tidy. I was pleased. The layout was very logical, so they fit a lot in. They had given us two doubles, and a room with a fridge, microwave, separate sink and disposable plates & utensils. The fridge was nice and cold (hate when you have to turn them on to get them going). If we had stayed more than one night, this set up would have been very helpful. Our 5th floor room looked out over the King5 station, and even though we saw the helicopter leave their roof at least twice, we could barely hear it. Bathroom had everything necessary, and a note to let them know if you had forgotten anything they could provide. Again, very clean. Free internet in your room, and they'll provide the cables if you've forgotten yours at home. My only complaint was that there was no breakfast in the lobby to come down to. Not even some coffee and/or tea to take with you as you go out the door. It's not that I was promised any, that's just something I'm used to - have a glass of juice and a muffin while you get ready to head out. Oh well. Overall our stay was uneventful and very restful. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: We thought that this Holiday Inn was better than others we have come across. The room was big, the beds were comfortable and we liked having a fridge and coffee pot in the room. The hotel is located very near the Space Needle and the Seattle Center and we found walking downtown not to be a problem at all. You can also hop on a bus to downtown from the 'free zone' which is only a few blocks away. The pool was small and uninviting and located in the Holiday Inn Select next door. The staff was so-so. They took care of business but I wouldn't call the two we dealt with as being 'friendly.' We paid $95 a night through Priceline. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: RaisinCity
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that would provide easy access to Seattle's major attractions and the Holiday Inn Seattle fit the bill very nicely. The hotel is within a few blocks walking distance to the Space Needle/Experience Music Project as well as the Monorail line that drops you off very close to the Public Market and Embarcadero area. We arrived a bit ahead of check in time, but the front desk staff wasted no time in identifying a room that had immediate availability. So, we were able to get situated and unpacked without delay. We parked in the hotel's underground garage (in/out privileges included, although we didn't need our car at all during our stay). Parking is $4.50 per night in the hotel garage, which was extremely reasonable for secured parking in the heart of the city! We took a stroll to the Monorail station at the base of the Space Needle and took the next train to Westlake Center Mall (there are no other stops). From there we followed the crowd to the Seattle Public Market (think fishmongers), which was a blast on a Sunday afternoon! You've also got easy access from here to an array of waterfront attractions and restaurants, although we were disappointed to discover that the IMAX theatre closed permanently only a week prior to our visit (to make room for an expansion of the aquarium). We returned to the Space Needle at about 9pm for our walk back to the hotel. It was here we experienced a little discomfort in that there seemed to be a large number of "locals" more or less loitering on the streets and sidewalks near the Space Needle at this time of the evening. We weren't sure if there was some kind of an event going on nearby but we were no longer among fellow tourists as we made our way back to the hotel. There was also a very large and visible police presence, which was comforting on one level but still begged the question as to the reason for it and whether it was "routine" for the area after dark. Regardless, we made it safely back to the hotel where we generally enjoyed a quiet overnight stay. The only complaint we had was with the occupant above us who seemed to be walking laps around his room late into the evening and early in the morning. Don't know what that was about, but certainly wasn't the hotel's fault, even though, when I mentioned it later, the desk staff said I would have been welcome to call them at the time and let them know about the noise. No comp breakfast at this hotel, but there are a few coffee shops and restaurants in the vicinity (including one at the hotel). Even though we stayed just one night, the hotel staff allowed us to continue to use the parking garage the next day while we explored the city a bit more. The total for the room, after taxes and parking, was about $170 for the night, which is a little higher than I normally like to pay. (You could also try the Holiday Inn Express located right next door). The proximity of the hotel meant I didn't have to drive in and out, which was very convenient, and the amenities were quite decent. The staff was friendly and helpful, so I would certainly recommend the Holiday Inn - Seattle to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBD
Reviews.Content: Well, okay, we stayed next door at the Express, but this hotel has the greatest restaurant, the Emerald Grill. We chose to eat there because we were tired and thought we could cope with a generic H. Inn burger, but what a surprise! The ambience is Holiday Inn, but the food is upscale without the prices. Lovely fresh scallops beautifully prepared, really fresh salad, delicious desserts. You expect this sort of cuisine at a top notch restaurant, and often don't get it. We were joined for our second dinner by three sets of diners from the first night - enough said. Stay here if only for the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBonnell
Reviews.Content: A great place - excellent location (near the Space Needle, bus route to downtown, and [suprise] a Starbucks), staff are great and very helpful (ask for the free cookies), and we managed to get a really good rate. Stayed for 3 nights (after an awful experience during our first night in Seattle at one of the adjacent "budget" hotels (yuck....)). Highly recommend this hotel. + Check out the nearby Korean restaurant "Stillas" (sp?)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place”
Reviews.Author: goingonatripee
Reviews.Content: We (family of four) arrived in Seattle 8:00am on a redeye flight and were ready for bed. We got to the hotel about 9:00 and left our baggage while we got some breakfast and checked out Pike Market via a minivan service (small charge). We returned at 11:30 thinking we could now have our naps since we were dragging...no such luck. We then decided to get some lunch but the hotel restaurant was closed for lunches on weekends. So we walked about 3 blocks (few restaurants in the area) to Shilla oriental food, very tasty. After our leisurely lunch we were sure that we would be able to take our much needed snoozes....no such luck, we then parked our cabooses in the lobby and promptly all four of us passed out. The hotel staff finally came and woke us up at 2:30 to tell us that our room was now ready. Technically, rooms are not guaranteed till 3pm, so we couldn't really complain. The hotel is your standard Holiday Inn, rooms are fine, pay for parking 4.50 per day, (underground lot which is under the hotel) and all in all not a bad place to stay. It wasn't in an exciting area as there were no restaurants or shopping areas nearby, but pretty close to the Space Needle Center. A seven min ride to the harbor and Pike Place. Also, the hotel restaurant food was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Generic Motor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: convert94
Reviews.Content: Two Holiday Inn's, back-to-back: This one and the H.I. Express Seattle. Very close to the space needle and a couple of blocks to the free bus zone going downtown. Generic rooms with microwave and mini-fridge. Newer properties, very clean and well equipted. Parking was $4.50 a day. This place is clean and well located to Seattle Center and within decent proximity to downtown.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Seattle
HotelInfo.Address: 211 Dexter Ave N, Seattle, WA 98109
